714593f-a.text:
80th Street, north side, east from 227 East 80th Street, between Third and Second Avenues.
February 2, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.

714592f-a.text:
227-231 East 80th Street, north side, between Third and Second Avenues. No. 227 is the Baptist Mission Society.
August 31, 1930.
P.L. Sperr.

714587f-a.text:
304 East 80th Street, adjoining the S.E. corner of Second Ave. Building shown is a 4-story frame house.
October 1, 1934.
P.L. Sperr.

714590f-a.text:
East 80th Street, west from Second Ave., showing the condition of the sidewalk on the south side of the street.
November 2, 1936.
W.P.A. Photo.
Federal Art Project.

714591f-a.text:
East 80th Street, west from (No. 240) a point slightly west of Second Ave., showing condition of the sidewalk on the south side of the street.
November 2, 1936.
W.P.A. Photo.
Federal Art Project.

714594f-a.text:
East 80th Street, west from (No. 224, left) a point midway between Second and Third Aves. (the latter shown with elevated line thereon). On the right, at the N.E. corner of Third Ave. appears the Manhattan Storage Warehouse.
November 2, 1936.
W.P.A. Photo.
Federal Art Project.

714586f-b.text:

707929f-b.text:
Second Avenue, north from East 80th Street as photographed from the uptown "El" platform. The view being northwestward, the west side of the Avenue is emphasized.
June 7, 1940
Views 1,2
P. L. Sperr

707929f-a.text:
Second Avenue, north from East 80th Street as photographed from the uptown "El" platform. The view being northwestward, the west side of the Avenue is emphasized.
June 7, 1940
Views 1,2
P. L. Sperr
